result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John F Brown

records.addlTxt: Defendant John F Brown in court.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for John F Brown in 20CF1988 and 21CF453.  Attorney Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn appears pro se in 22CF1505. State filed a joinder motion. Defn objects to joinder motion. Colloquy w/ counsel RE: trial procedurally if defn waives right to atty in 22CF1505 and cases are joined. Colloquy w/ defn RE: right to an atty in 22CF1505. CT finds waiver for this hearing is knowing, intelligent and voluntary. Argument by Atty Benavides;RE: joinder motion. Colloquy w/ defn. Defn wishes Atty Benavides to continue to represent him in the Branch 14 cases. Argument by ADA Hess. CT makes findings and denies joinder motion. Bail cont. CT to set trial dates in 22CF1505 and address Other Acts Motion once Branch 14 cases resolve.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
  Ct accepts defn's waiver of right to atty; Ct finds Cts 1 & 2 transactionally related; Witness duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover; Ct binds case over;   Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; IInformation read out loud at the requset of defn; Defn enters a plea of not guilty; motions due within 20 days; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

02:10 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
